channel.title: All R-Rated Films To Be Treated Like Porn In South Australia
channel.description:
I thought this deserved it's own thread so people can :rage:
My state just passed the stupidest censorship and nanny-state law in the history of laws
[url]https://www.gizmodo.com.au/2010/01/all-r-rated-films-to-be-treated-like-porn-in-south-australia/[/url]
[url=https://digg.com/movies/All_R_Rated_Films_To_Be_Treated_Like_Porn_In_South_Australia]DIGG LINK, PLEASE DIGG IT![/url] [quote] The first change in the law, which says that you can’t display R-rated movies alongside movies of other ratings, requires a dedicated area for all R-rated content, which needs to be clearly marked with this statement (in font at least 15mm high):
R 18+ FILMS AREA—THE PUBLIC ARE WARNED THAT MATERIAL DISPLAYED IN THIS AREA MAY CAUSE OFFENCE. [/quote]
[quote] The second part of the new laws restricts the ability to advertise R18+ rated films. Businesses (including cinemas) can no longer show trailers for R-rated films or display promotional material such as posters, pamphlets or other printed material [/quote] :rage:
One thing I don't get is the no-advertising. When new R18 films come out in SA, how will people who don't use the Internet find out about them? The cinemas won't even be able to have posters so you'll only know they're on if you happen to see the time listings =\
Also is it legal to disallow R18 movies to advertise. Surely the big studios will be pissed!

item.dc:creator: Tmaned
item.description:
DansonDelta40:

The upper section is REALLY called the NEGRO half?

(curious - I honestly don’t know)

I think back in the day all the black folk would have to sit in the upper section of the court room, while the white man got the lower seats, where they probably had a better view, or something.

Something to do with a fellow with the name of Crow.

item.description:
Jambo:

I thought this deserved it’s own thread so people can

My state just passed the stupidest censorship and nanny-state law in the history of laws

https://www.gizmodo.com.au/2010/01/all-r-rated-films-to-be-treated-like-porn-in-south-australia/

DIGG LINK, PLEASE DIGG IT!

One thing I don’t get is the no-advertising. When new R18 films come out in SA, how will people who don’t use the Internet find out about them? The cinemas won’t even be able to have posters so you’ll only know they’re on if you happen to see the time listings =\

Also is it legal to disallow R18 movies to advertise. Surely the big studios will be pissed!

Ying and Yang my friend, you Aussies get a preview article about BMS, and now this. It’s all about balance, Ying and mothafuckin’ Yang :lol:
